A further individual with compound heterozygous for the missense substitutions p.(Arg739Cys)(Phe556Ser) with microcephaly, growth and developmental delay and neonatal cholestasis was described in 2017 and a seven year old boy compound heterozygous for p.(Gln671fs)(Thr69Ile) has also been reported with hepatopathy, hypotonia, intellectual disability and growth retardation.. Here, we present a child with cytosolic IARS deficiency, whose main clinical feature was refractory inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), hitherto not previously described in other patients with IARS deficiency.
